intro: Ononis fruticosa, commonly known as thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Ononis fruticosa is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in harsh, arid environments.
